alert.note: Alert for Municipality of Skagway (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 18 at 11:19AM AKST until January 20 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...Very cold northerly outflow winds causing hazardous conditions... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST SATURDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero near White Pass. Blowing snow with white out conditions. * WHERE...The Klondike Highway in the municipality of Skagway. * WHEN...Until 6 AM AKST Saturday. * IMPACTS...The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. Visibilities will be reduced to one half mile or less at times in blowing snow * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Wind chill values may rise above -30 degrees at times during the daytime hours, but will fall back down to -30 or lower in the overnight hours. Reduced visibilities in blowing snow will make vehicular travel very hazardous.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. For the latest road conditions, where available, call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
